newsitem.title: USA: Ralph Lauren stock poised for gains. [CORRECTED 22:55 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Ralph Lauren stock poised for gains. [CORRECTED 22:55 GMT]

text.p: Polo Ralph Lauren Corp sold shares for $26 each Wednesday in the second largest initial public offering this year, raising roughly $767 million.
Stock in the fashion designer is expected to jump nearly $5 when it begins trading Thursday on the New York Stock Exchange, analysts say.

The offering will make an even richer man out of Ralph Lauren, a former necktie salesman from the Bronx whose original name is Ralph Lifshitz, and is expected to spur other designers to take their fashion houses to Wall Street. (Corrects spelling of original surname)
"This is the biggest payday in the history of Seventh Avenue," said Alan Millstein, editor and publisher of the Fashion Report, referring to the traditional home of the fashion industry.
Despite the enormous size of the offering, even portfolio managers at some of the top U.S. investment banks were not sure if they could get a piece of the red-hot deal.
"I don't even know if I'm getting an allocation," said Arden Armstrong, portfolio manager at Miller Anderson & Sherrerd LLP, which manages over $41.4 billion of assets.
